result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jose Francisco Serrano-Serrano in court with attorney Xavier Solis.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
Status Conference held.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial.  Any motions are due November 1, 2022.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for January 3, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm
Stipulation and Order Regarding use of Videotaped Statements.  Signed and Filed.  nk

Defendant Jose Francisco Serrano-Serrano in court with attorney Xavier Solis.  Jennifer Jean Tate for Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

*Spanish Interpreter sworn: Reme Bashi.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  Defense is waiting for Discovery and requested more time to review.  Status conference scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Defendant Jose Francisco Serrano-Serrano in court with attorney Xavier Solis appear in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer E.McDaris.  Sworn as Spanish interpreter: Kelley Salas.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, court enter a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Branch 12.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk
Notice of Retainer.  Received and Filed.  nk

05/06/2022. th
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KBJ

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.

Defendant Jose Francisco Serrano-Serrano in court with attorney Xavier Solis.  Defendant Jose Francisco Serrano-Serrano in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jose Francisco Serrano-Serrano appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Borowski, Branch 12.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a Preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.   Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
